title: Derivation of the completeness axiom from ZF set theory

blocks.name: hilmet
blocks.content: The Hilbert space norm determines a metric space. (Contributed by NM, 17-Apr-2007.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: hilxmet
blocks.content: The Hilbert space norm determines a metric space. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Sep-2015.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: hilmetdval
blocks.content: Value of the distance function of the metric space of Hilbert space. (Contributed by NM, 17-Apr-2007.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: hilims
blocks.content: Hilbert space distance metric. (Contributed by NM, 13-Sep-2007.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: hhcau
blocks.content: The Cauchy sequences of Hilbert space. (Contributed by NM, 19-Nov-2007.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: hhlm
blocks.content: The limit sequences of Hilbert space. (Contributed by NM, 19-Nov-2007.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: hhcmpl
blocks.content: Lemma used for derivation of the completeness axiom ~ ax-hcompl from ZFC Hilbert space theory. (Contributed by NM, 9-Apr-2008.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm hhcmpl(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, ccauold), wrex(s0, chba, wbr(c0, chli, cv(s0))))
  -| wceq(c1, cop(cop(cva, csm), cno))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cims, c1))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cmopn, c2))
  -| wi(wcel(c0, cfv(ccau, c2)), wrex(s0, chba, wbr(c0, cfv(clm, c3), cv(s0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  3imtr4i(wcel(c0, ccauold), wrex(s0, chba, wbr(c0, chli, cv(s0))), wcel(c0, cin(cfv(ccau, c2), co(chba, cmap, cn))), wrex(s0, chba, wa(wcel(c0, co(chba, cmap, cn)), wbr(c0, cfv(clm, c3), cv(s0)))))
  3imtr4i(wcel(c0, cin(cfv(ccau, c2), co(chba, cmap, cn))), wrex(s0, chba, wa(wcel(c0, co(chba, cmap, cn)), wbr(c0, cfv(clm, c3), cv(s0)))), wa(wcel(c0, cfv(ccau, c2)), wcel(c0, co(chba, cmap, cn))), wa(wcel(c0, co(chba, cmap, cn)), wrex(s0, chba, wbr(c0, cfv(clm, c3), cv(s0)))))
  anim1ci(wcel(c0, cfv(ccau, c2)), wcel(c0, co(chba, cmap, cn)), wrex(s0, chba, wbr(c0, cfv(clm, c3), cv(s0))))
  elin(c0, cfv(ccau, c2), co(chba, cmap, cn))
  r19.42v(s0, chba, wcel(c0, co(chba, cmap, cn)), wbr(c0, cfv(clm, c3), cv(s0)))
  eleq2i(c0, ccauold, cin(cfv(ccau, c2), co(chba, cmap, cn)))
  hhcau(c2, c1)
  rexbii(s0, chba, wbr(c0, chli, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(c0, co(chba, cmap, cn)), wbr(c0, cfv(clm, c3), cv(s0))))
  bitri(wbr(c0, chli, cv(s0)), wa(wcel(c0, co(chba, cmap, cn)), wbr(c0, cfv(clm, c3), cv(s0))), wbr(c0, cres(cfv(clm, c3), co(chba, cmap, cn)), cv(s0)))
  breqi(c0, chli, cv(s0), cres(cfv(clm, c3), co(chba, cmap, cn)))
  hhlm(c3, c1, c2)
  brresi(c0, cfv(clm, c3), co(chba, cmap, cn), cv(s0))
  vex(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, co(chba, cmap, cn))
  diff.co.s(s0, chba, cmap, cn)
  diff.chba.s(s0)
  diff.cmap.s(s0)
  diff.cn.s(s0)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm hhcmpl(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ Cauchy → ∃(s0 ∈ ~H, c0[~~>v]s0))
  ⊣ c1 = < < +h, .h >, normh >
  ⊣ c2 =(IndMet ` c1)
  ⊣ c3 =(MetOpen ` c2)
  ⊣ (c0 ∈(Cau ` c2)→ ∃(s0 ∈ ~H, c0[(~~>t ` c3)]s0))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  3imtr4i(c0 ∈ Cauchy, ∃(s0 ∈ ~H, c0[~~>v]s0), c0 ∈((Cau ` c2)⋂(~H[↦]ℕ)), ∃(s0 ∈ ~H,(c0 ∈(~H[↦]ℕ)∧ c0[(~~>t ` c3)]s0)))
  3imtr4i(c0 ∈((Cau ` c2)⋂(~H[↦]ℕ)), ∃(s0 ∈ ~H,(c0 ∈(~H[↦]ℕ)∧ c0[(~~>t ` c3)]s0)), (c0 ∈(Cau ` c2)∧ c0 ∈(~H[↦]ℕ)), (c0 ∈(~H[↦]ℕ)∧ ∃(s0 ∈ ~H, c0[(~~>t ` c3)]s0)))
  anim1ci(c0 ∈(Cau ` c2), c0 ∈(~H[↦]ℕ), ∃(s0 ∈ ~H, c0[(~~>t ` c3)]s0))
  elin(c0, (Cau ` c2), (~H[↦]ℕ))
  r19.42v(s0, chba, c0 ∈(~H[↦]ℕ), c0[(~~>t ` c3)]s0)
  eleq2i(c0, ccauold, ((Cau ` c2)⋂(~H[↦]ℕ)))
  hhcau(c2, c1)
  rexbii(s0, chba, c0[~~>v]s0, (c0 ∈(~H[↦]ℕ)∧ c0[(~~>t ` c3)]s0))
  bitri(c0[~~>v]s0, (c0 ∈(~H[↦]ℕ)∧ c0[(~~>t ` c3)]s0), c0[((~~>t ` c3)|`(~H[↦]ℕ))]s0)
  breqi(c0, chli, s0, ((~~>t ` c3)|`(~H[↦]ℕ)))
  hhlm(c3, c1, c2)
  brresi(c0, (~~>t ` c3), (~H[↦]ℕ), s0)
  vex(s0)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, (~H[↦]ℕ))
  diff.co.s(s0, chba, cmap, cn)
  diff.chba.s(s0)
  diff.cmap.s(s0)
  diff.cn.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: hilcompl
blocks.content: Lemma used for derivation of the completeness axiom ~ ax-hcompl from ZFC Hilbert space theory. The first five hypotheses would be satisfied by the definitions described in ~ ax-hilex ; the 6th would be satisfied by ~ eqid ; the 7th by a given fixed Hilbert space; and the last by theorem ~ hlcompl . (Contributed by NM, 13-Sep-2007.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 14-May-2014.) (New usage is discouraged.)
blocks.origin:
thm hilcompl(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  |- wi(wcel(c0, ccauold), wrex(s0, chba, wbr(c0, chli, cv(s0))))
  -| wceq(chba, cfv(cba, c1))
  -| wceq(cva, cfv(cpv, c1))
  -| wceq(csm, cfv(cns, c1))
  -| wceq(csp, cfv(cdip, c1))
  -| wceq(c2, cfv(cims, c1))
  -| wceq(c3, cfv(cmopn, c2))
  -| wcel(c1, chlo)
  -| wi(wcel(c0, cfv(ccau, c2)), wrex(s0, chba, wbr(c0, cfv(clm, c3), cv(s0))))
  -| diffsc(s0, c0)
} = {
  hhcmpl(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3)
  hilhhi(c1)
  hlnvi(c1)
}
blocks.pretty:
thm hilcompl(setvar s0, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3) {
  ⊢ (c0 ∈ Cauchy → ∃(s0 ∈ ~H, c0[~~>v]s0))
  ⊣ ~H =(BaseSet ` c1)
  ⊣ +h =(+v ` c1)
  ⊣ .h =(.sOLD ` c1)
  ⊣ .ih =(.iOLD ` c1)
  ⊣ c2 =(IndMet ` c1)
  ⊣ c3 =(MetOpen ` c2)
  ⊣ c1 ∈ CHilOLD
  ⊣ (c0 ∈(Cau ` c2)→ ∃(s0 ∈ ~H, c0[(~~>t ` c3)]s0))
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
} = {
  hhcmpl(s0, c0, c1, c2, c3)
  hilhhi(c1)
  hlnvi(c1)
}
